sentence.Network_en: Scurrilous and untrue stories were being invented.
sentence.Network_cn: 有人正在捏造虚假诽谤的故事。

sentence.Network_en: She was often quite scurrilous in her references to me.
sentence.Network_cn: 她一提起我,常常骂骂咧咧的.

sentence.Network_en: Her scurrilous performances have already condemned her.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的信口漫骂的演出已给她定了罪.

PerfectNetExp.abs: GRE词汇精选（核心词汇） ... sculptor 雕刻家 scurrilous 下流的 scurry 急跑，疾行.
scurrility 谈吐粗鄙scurrilous 说话粗鄙scurrilously 下流地
中英对照注释红楼梦第二十一回贤袭人娇嗔箴宝... ... quatrain 四行诗 scurrilous 庸俗下流的 travesty 歪曲曲解.
ribald adj．下流的，粗鄙的scurrilous adj．下流的、恶言毁谤的vulgar adj．无教养的，下流的

list.abs: 2011-02-13 16:17:08scurrilous charges 诽谤的指控atone for为……赎罪 Noting can atone for your negligenc.
heard the scurrilous accusation being made about him ., 听到人们对他的恶意诽谤和职责.
Her scurrilous performances have already condemned her ., 她的信口漫骂的演出已给她定了罪.
If you know something scurrilous about your boss , you have a weapon against her ., 如果你知道老板的某些龌龊事儿 , 你就有了一个对付她的武器.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from French scurrile or Latin scurrilus (from scurra 'buffoon') + -ous

entry.tran: 恶语诽谤的;造谣中伤的
entry.def: Scurrilous accusations or stories are untrue and unfair, and are likely to damage the reputation of the person that they relate to.

example.ex: Scurrilous and untrue stories were being invented.
example.tran: 有人正在捏造虚假诽谤的故事。

auth_sentence.content: He described the preface as scurrilous, sour and vindictive.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: He described the preface as scurrilous, sour and vindictive.

auth_sentence.content: Within days, scurrilous placards appeared in Edinburgh, depicting Mary as a whore and accusing her and Bothwell of the crime.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Within days, scurrilous placards appeared in Edinburgh, depicting Mary as a whore and accusing her and Bothwell of the crime.
